eval_log.py

Skript to evaluate the task logs.

Author

Karla Friedrichs

Evaluation Skript To Bachelor Thesis

"Modeling collaborative reference in a Pentomino domain using the GOLMI framework"

Usage
python3 eval_log.py
Variables
DATA_COLLECTION_PATH
DATA_COLLECTION_PATH

directory containing json files, one per participant

PLOT_PATH
PLOT_PATH

directory to save created plots to

N_TASKS
N_TASKS

number of tasks, used to evaluate all tasks with indes up to N_TASKS

AMBIG_TASKS
AMBIG_TASKS

list of ambiguous tasks (see thesis)

UNAMBIG_TASKS
UNAMBIG_TASKS

list of unambiguous tasks (see thesis)

ALGORITHMS
ALGORITHMS

list of algorithm names

LINESTYLES
LINESTYLES

dictionary mapping algorithm names to matplotlib linestyles to use for plots

MARKERSTYLES
MARKERSTYLES

dictionary mapping algorithm names to matplotlib markers to use for scatter plots

COLORS
COLORS

dictionary mapping algorithm names to colors to use for scatter plots

Functions
eval_log

Evaluates the GOLMI logs: print statistics and creates plots for incorrect attempts and time needed by participants.

read_logs

Reads in all json files and extract task logs.

Returns

dict mapping algorithm to dict with entries 'log', 'target', 'incorrect attempts'

eval_incorrect_attempts

Prints out information on the attempts needed by participants to solve each task. One plot is created.

Params
log

parsed log data

savename

str, name for the plot. The plot file will be called 'incorrect_attempts_NAME.png'.

tasks

optional: task indexes to include default: indices 0 to N_TASKS -1

eval_time_to_solve

Prints out information on the time participants needed to solve tasks as well as the number of instructions given.  Creates two plots.

Params
log

parsed log data

savename

str, name for the plot. The plot files will be called 'feedback_NAME.png' and 'time_NAME_png'.

tasks

optional: task indexes to include.  default: indices 0 to N_TASKS -1
